fields.Title of Presentation: <span style="font-size:11pt;">Wicked Problems: Strategies for Researchers as Agents for Public Engagement</span>
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: 2023 Annual Meeting of the Public Philosophy Network
fields.Description/Abstract:
<p>To say that our contemporary society faces a multitude of wicked problems is as much a diagnosis of our reality as it is a vacuous platitude. In an age of civil unrest and economic injustice – all backgrounded by climate change – it may be that all of the problems we face are wicked. It is at least plausible that the issues we researchers engage in are most often those sorts characterized as wicked.</p>
Wickedness begets ontological, epistemic, and ethical divergences that provide opportunity for the public scholar to engage. In this workshop, participants will both learn about wicked problems <em>qua </em>wicked problems and develop strategies to use the framing of wicked problems as a facilitative tool to help concerned publics navigate the problems they face. Grappling with the complexities of wicked problems is itself a discursive tool that can help the public articulate assumed values, frame problems, and define solution sets that help coordinate social action.
